stimulus:
In this study, you will read text scenarios and make slider judgments about the situations which they describe. Here is an image of an example trial.


In the upcoming trials, please read the descriptions and give your answer by clicking on the slider. Please read each scenario description carefully, but we are interested in your intuitive judgment so no need to second-guess yourself.

You must make a slider judgment in each trial. You will not receive any feedback.


When you are ready to begin, press the start button.

Amy's boyfriend Jake wants to talk about their date this weekend, but Amy is tired:
Jake: "Hey, can we talk about this weekend?"
Amy: "I'm rather exhausted right now. Would it be okay if we talk about it tomorrow instead?"

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Amy?

Anna notices her friend, Jake, coughing frequently during their hike.
Anna: "You've been coughing a lot today. I'm rather concerned that you might be coming down with something. Have you seen a doctor?"

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Anna?

Emma asks her grandmother for guidance on how to cook a traditional family dish.
Emma: "Thanks for explaining the steps so clearly, Grandma. You've been really helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Emma find her Grandma's help?

David watches a professional surfer ride a massive wave.
David: "That was rather awe-inspiring. The skill and bravery it takes to ride a wave like that is unbelievable."

On a scale from "minimally awe-inspiring" to "maximally awe-inspiring", how awe-inspired is David?

Sarah shares why she got upset during a group discussion.
Sarah: "I got defensive because the topic hit close to home for me."
Friend: "That's deeply understandable. It's hard to stay calm when it's something so personal."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Sarah 's reason for her friend?

David explains to his manager why he didn't complete a presentation on time.
David: "I didn't get the data I needed from the supplier until this morning, so I couldn't finish the slides."
Manager: "That's utterly understandable. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help you stay on track."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is David's reason for his manager?

During a coffee break, an Mike notices their colleague looking overwhelmed.
Mike: "You seem swamped with work lately. I'm really concerned that you might be taking on too much."

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Mike?

During a job interview, the interviewer comments on the candidate's art portfolio.
Interviewer: "Your portfolio is utterly impressive. The way your work addresses important social issues and provokes thought is remarkable."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressive is the interviewer?

At a hackathon, a team presents their fully functional prototype after 24 hours of coding.
Judge: "It's impressive how you managed to create such a polished product in such a short time."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is the judge?

Rachel reflects on the lecture with a friend afterward:
Friend: "How was the astrophysics lecture? I heard the professor is supposed to be brilliant."
Rachel: "The topic is undoubtedly fascinating, but I found the lecture boring. Without a stronger background in the subject, it was difficult to stay engaged."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the lecture for Rachel?

Sophie visits a national park known for its majestic mountains and valleys.
Sophie: "The landscape here is awe-inspiring. I feel so small in comparison to these towering peaks."

On a scale from "minimally awe-inspiring" to "maximally awe-inspiring", how awe-inspired is Sophie?

Ben loses his wallet in a busy park and asks a security guard for assistance.
Ben: "Thank you for helping me check the lost and found. You've been helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Ben the security guard's help?

John invites his friend Alex to a weekend camping trip, but Alex declines because of he is tired.
Alex: "I'd love to go, but I think I need some rest this weekend."
John: "That's understandable. You've been taking on a lot recently. We can plan another trip later in the year."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Alex's reason for John?

Sophia watches her younger sibling perform a difficult gymnastics routine.
Sophia: "That was rather impressive. I can't believe how much you've improved!"

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is Sophia?

Lisa meets with her child's teacher to discuss declining grades.
Lisa: "I noticed my son's grades have dropped significantly, and I'm deeply concerned about how this might affect his future."

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Lisa?

During a safari in Africa, Lily spots a herd of elephants in the wild.
Lily: "This is awe-inspiring! Seeing these majestic animals in their natural habitat is incredible."

On a scale from "minimally awe-inspiring" to "maximally awe-inspiring", how awe-inspired is Lily?

A tour guide shares historical facts about an ancient castle.
Visitor: "Your knowledge of the history here is really impressive. I've learned so much today."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is the visitor?

Sophia watches her younger sibling perform a difficult gymnastics routine.
Sophia: "That was impressive. I can't believe how much you've improved!"

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is Sophia?

David's classmate asks him to stay up late to review material for an upcoming exam.
Classmate: "Can we go over the practice questions one more time tonight?"
David: "I'd love to help, but I'm fairly exhausted from studying all day. I think I need to rest to do well tomorrow."

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is David?

Anna tells her professor that she needs a few extra days to complete an assignment due to family obligations.
Anna: "I'm very sorry, but could I have an extension on the assignment? I had a family emergency."
Professor: "That's rather understandable, Anna. Take the extra time you need."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Anna's reason for her professor?

Alice sees a performance by a world-renowned ballerina.
Alice: "Her movements were so graceful and powerful. It was really awe-inspiring."

On a scale from "minimally awe-inspiring" to "maximally awe-inspiring", how awe-inspired is Alice?

Lucy notices her dog has been unusually lethargic and hasn't eaten much.
Lucy: "I'm utterly concerned about Max. He hasn't been himself lately. I think we should take him to the vet."

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Lucy?

David explains to his manager why he didn't complete a presentation on time.
David: "I didn't get the data I needed from the supplier until this morning, so I couldn't finish the slides."
Manager: "That's understandable. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help you stay on track."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is David's reason for his manager?

David shows his friend Emma a model airplane he built from scratch.
Emma: "Wow, David! The level of detail on this is deeply impressive."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressive is Emma?

During a group project, Alex helps Jessica by clarifying some confusing instructions.
Jessica: "I appreciate you taking the time to explain that. You've been helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Jessica find Alex's help?

Emma attends a virtual conference on data analysis.
Colleague: "That keynote speaker had some great insights, don't you think?"
Emma: "Honestly, I found it boring. They were just repeating things I already knew."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the conference for Emma?

Rachel: "The topic is undoubtedly fascinating, but I found the lecture really boring. Without a stronger background in the subject, it was difficult to stay engaged."

During a book club discussion, Alex shares their thoughts.
Member: "This book kept me hooked until the very last page!"
Alex: "I wish I felt the same, but I found the story boring. The slow pacing just didn't work for me."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the story for Alex?

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is Emma?

Sophie's friend asks her to help with party preparations the night before the event.
Friend: "Can you stay late to help finish decorating for tomorrow?"
Sophie: "I've been running errands all day, and I'm utterly exhausted. I'll come early tomorrow to help instead."

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Sophie?

Emma apologizes for missing a virtual meeting due to internet problems.
Emma: "I'm sorry I couldn't join the meeting earlier. My internet went out unexpectedly."
Colleague: "That's understandable. Technology can be unpredictable sometimes."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Emma's reason for her colleague?

Sophie and her friend, Mia, attend a classical music recital.
Mia: "The performance was so elegant. I loved how the orchestra played together."
Sophie: "I found it boring. Classical music isn't quite my style."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the recital for Sophie?

During a casual conversation after class, Emily shares her thoughts with Andy about their mutual friend Jake:
Emily: "I'm fairly concerned about Jake. He hasn't been participating in class and seems withdrawn. Do you think he's okay?"

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Emily?

Mia's sister asks her to babysit her kids for an evening.
Sister: "Could you watch the kids for a few hours tonight?"
Mia: "I wish I could, but I'm exhausted after chasing my own little ones all day. Can we plan for another time?"

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Mia?
